intro: Pedicularis resupinata f. spicata, commonly known as the spicate lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, with a distinctive downward-facing orientation. Its leaves are opposite and sessile, often appearing in pairs along the stem. This variant is distinguished by its dense, spiculate inflorescence, which gives it its specific epithet.
